column1: #Text=Polycrystalline powders of BaNa-122 were synthesized by a solid-state reaction.

#Text=Prior to the synthesis, BaAs, NaAs, and Fe2As powders were prepared as precursors by mixing elemental Ba, Na, Fe, and As chunks at stoichiometric molar ratio, sealing them into quartz tubes (BaAs and Fe2As) or stainless-steel container (NaAs), and heating at 650 °C (BaAs and NaAs) and 750 °C (Fe2As).
#Text=The precursors were mixed in the ratio of BaAs: NaAs: Fe2As = 0.6: 0.45: 1.
#Text=Here, the target Na concentration was x = 0.4 so as to yield highest Tc of 34.2 K.
#Text=Extra NaAs was added considering the possible loss of Na and As during the synthesis process.
#Text=The mixed powders were put in an alumina crucible and then sealed in a stainless-steel container, then sintered at 770 °C for 15 hours.
#Text=The polycrystalline powders were pressed into a pellet by applying a pressure of about 100 MPa.
#Text=The pellet was packed into a silver tube having an outer diameter of 10 mm and an inner diameter of 4.3 mm.
#Text=The silver tube was groove-rolled into a square wire with the 1.2 × 1.2 mm2 cross-sectional and subsequently flat-rolled into a tape with a thickness of 0.48 mm.
#Text=The flat rolled tape was uniaxial cold-pressed between stainless steel disks under a pressure of approximately 1.0 GPa.
#Text=After this press process the thickness of tape was reduced to 0.20 mm.
#Text=The thin tape was cut into 50 mm long pieces, sealed into a stainless-steel container in a N2-filled glove box, and sintered at 875 °C for 3 h.
